content: is there such a thing as  clockwork/mechanical tracking platform for astrophotography.?

Yes, there are clockwork/mechanical tracking platforms specifically designed for astrophotography. These tracking platforms are used to counteract the Earth's rotation and allow for longer exposure times, resulting in sharper and more detailed astrophotographs. They typically have motorized gears or clockwork mechanisms that rotate the camera or telescope at the same rate as the Earth's rotation, effectively keeping the celestial objects in the frame without any motion blur. These tracking platforms can be manually operated or controlled electronically, depending on the model.
